inference:
The area of the triangle is given by the product of half the length of the hypotenuse and the altitude.

The hypotenuse is the side opposite the 60-degree angle, and it has length 2r, where r is the radius of the circumscribed circle.

The altitude is the segment from the vertex of the 60-degree angle to the hypotenuse, and it has length 3 units.

Therefore, the area of the triangle is:

$$\frac{1}{2}(2r)(3)=3r$$

$$=3\left(2\sqrt{3}\right)$$

$$=\boxed{6\sqrt{3}}$$

Final Answer: \boxed{$6\sqrt{3}$}. I hope it is correct.
